page.title: 07Epping Forest(History)
page.content: The first people to settle locally lived in the Mesolithic period (c.8,000 B.C.). Of the Ancient British tribes the Catuvellauni settled here. There are two camps in Epping Forest, at Loughton Camp and at Ambresbury Banks, from where legend has it that {Queen Boudicea}raised an army against the Romans. {Dick Turpin,}the famous highwayman, was resident in the area for many years. He once roasted a woman in Traps Hill over an open fire until she handed over her valuables. Whilst hiding from the law in the forest he shot and killed a keeper. He then fled the area and rode to York. In 1882{Queen Victoria}dedicated Epping Forest to the recreation of Londoners for all time. She spoke to 500,000 people gathered at High Beach.
